perturbation.original_text: The term of the Franchise shall be twenty (20) years, commencing on January 1, 2016.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of the Franchise shall be twenty (20) years, commencing on January 1, 2016, unless terminated earlier as per section 10.
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'unless terminated earlier as per section 10' introduces a contingency to the defined term. If section 10 contains vague termination clauses, it makes the '20 years' term ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise maintain at least one business office within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. Such office shall be open at least forty (40) hours per week for the conduct of business between Grantee and its customers.
perturbation.changed_text: Grantee shall during the term of this Franchise make reasonable efforts to maintain a business presence within the Territorial Limits of Grantor. While the Grantee intends to maintain an office open for business, the operating hours are subject to change based on market demands.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'maintain at least one business office' to 'make reasonable efforts to maintain a business presence' weakens the obligation. Removing the '40 hours per week' requirement and adding 'subject to change based on market demands' makes the commitment to a physical office and its operational hours uncertain, conflicting with an implicit assumption of a consistent business location.

perturbation.original_text: All notices required under this Agreement or the Ordinance shall be in writing and shall be deemed validly given, unless otherwise required, when sent by certified mail, return receipt requested, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier, addressed as follows (or any other address the party to be notified may have designated to the sender by like notice):
perturbation.changed_text: All notices required under this Agreement or the Ordinance should ideally be in writing and should be considered for delivery via certified mail, return receipt requested, or by a nationally recognized overnight courier, addressed as follows (or any other address the party to be notified may have designated to the sender by like notice):
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall be' to 'should ideally be' and 'shall be deemed validly given' to 'should be considered for delivery' significantly weakens the mandatory nature of the notice requirement. This introduces ambiguity about the validity and method of delivering notices, making enforcement difficult and contradicting any sections relying on strict adherence to notice procedures.
